td.content: s:patient presents with 2 years history of intrusive thoughts, vivid flashbacks and severe agitation. pt is a F aged 75 Ys. o:Height 177 cm, Weight 72.2 kg, Temperature 37.3 C, Pulse 88, SystolicBP 116, DiastolicBP 76, Respiration 17, avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to psychology.

td.content: s:75 year old white female retired complained of severe agitation, vivid flashbacks and intrusive thoughts. Reports exposure to emotional abuse, 3/6/1960. she consumes 2 drinks per night she denies ever using cigarettes o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. BDI 25, CAPS B=3,C=4,D=3. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed BDI, CAPS, and performed socialization to treatment - Explained that symptoms were common for someone having experienced such trauma; socialization to treatment - Discussed Safety Plan; counseling about life problems - Discussed other life issues - learned that Patient had concern about their drug abuse; counseling about life problems - Suggested various social services available for helping to deal with their drug abuse; counseling about life problems - Discussed with patient their social support network; Psychiatric diagnostic evaluation - Completed, and ordered homework (fill out standard intake forms), homework (read handouts about PTSD therapy).

Term.LATERALITY: Effect of exposure to external cause

td.content: s:female retired aged 75 ys with C/O vivid flashbacks for 4 weeks. pt also reports intrusive thoughts, severe agitation stemming from exposure to emotional abuse (3/6/1960). o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. Review of intake forms done, BDI 25, Suicide assessment moderate. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed Review of intake forms, BDI, Suicide assessment, and performed socialization to treatment - Discussed homework - helped patient start to fill in goal worksheet; counseling about life problems - Discussed social services to help with their drug abuse; social service referral - Patient agreed they wanted to try NA; socialization to treatment - Discussed Cognitive-behavioral model of PTSD and that such treatments were mostly contraindicated until patient has stabilized and reduced level of anxiety; socialization to treatment - Discussed value of anxiety management exercises; anxiety management skills - Asked patient to list activities that were found to be relaxing; anxiety management skills - Asked patient to choose a previously close confidant to reengage with; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (finish writing goals for therapy), homework (set up appointment with social service), homework (participate in some of the activities identified as relaxing), homework (attempt to contact previously supportive person and talk with them).

Term.LATERALITY: Effect of exposure to external cause

td.content: s:white F retired aged 75 ys presents with 6 weeks history of worsening intrusive thoughts, severe agitation and vivid flashbacks. Initial trauma: emotional abuse. o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. Review of patient goals done. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed Review of patient goals, and performed socialization to treatment - Reviewed Safety Plan in light of homework; counseling about life problems - Discussed patient interaction with NA; social service referral - Patient agreed to continue working with NA; socialization to treatment - Reviewed relaxation activities since last appointment; socialization to treatment - Reviewed attempt to reengage with former socially supportive person; anxiety management skills - Sleep disruption exercises: discussed sleep hygiene and deep breathing for reengaging with sleep; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills), homework (Continue to participate in activities listed as relaxing), homework (Attempt to have second positive interaction with reengaged support person).

td.content: s:female retired aged 75 ys c/o 7 weeks h/o trouble staying asleep, frequent vivid nightmares and difficulty participating in activities. Exposed to emotional abuse approx. 53 years ago. o:appropriate behavior with no abnormal movement, good eye contact, appears agitated, denies suicidal/homicidal ideation intent or plan, normal speech but slow rate, oriented x 3, poor concentration, affect is appropriate with normal range. Suicide assessment moderate. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed Suicide assessment, and performed anxiety management skills - Breathing relaxation and progressive muscle relaxation skills practiced; anxiety management skills - Thought stopping skill practiced; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Socratic dialog used to help patient understand that choices made at time of the traumatic incident were rational at the time; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills).
